Course_Detail: LL.M. is a two year (4 semesters) Master Degree Programme in Law. The products of this course would be suitable not only in the world of academics but also in organisations dealing with Government policies. Because of their practical learning, NGOs, financial organisations, cooperatives would be ready to pick up LL.M. products as legal staff. Further, to facilitate students for entry into academics, the syllabus has been designed as per the requirement of UGC-NET. Master of Law (LL.M.) under the School of Public Policy and Law in the University is a highly sought after programme. The syllabus is quite comprehensive and has sufficient depth to enable the students to gather knowledge and competency in the subject. Broadly, the syllabus includes Legal Theory, Constitutional Law of India: The New Challenges, Legal Research Methodology, Theory of Legislation, Law and Social Transformation in India

Eligiblity: Medium of instruction and examination shall be English alone. The minimum eligibility condition is 45% marks in 10+2, preference being given to those having higher marks. The marks scored in CLAT and L-SAT shall be given due weightage in preparation of merit list for admission. However it shall be open to the Director of MATS Law School to consider exceptional cases of less than 45% keeping in view that the University is situated in a tribal area. The maximum age for Honors degree courses shall be 20 years for General and OBC category and 22 years in case of candidates from SC/ST, as on 1st July of the year of admission. Admission shall be given according to the admission rules of the University wherein these rules shall be read as exception for MATS Law School. Delayed admissions after last date fixed by the university may be permitted in special cases by the Vice Chancellor on the recommendation of the Director, MATS Law School, subject to availability of seats. Admissions shall ordinarily be made in first semester but transfer cases may be allowed in any semester of any course at any level from any University subject to the candidate appearing in compliance examinations which means he will be exempted in the paper/papers he has passed from his original University and his clearing the papers he has not passed as per course matrix of MATS Law School.
Course_Detail: B.Tech. LL.B. [Six Years Integrated (Hons.) Law Degree Course]Semester Pattern (12 Semesters) program offered by MATS University, Raipur and approved by BCI.

Eligiblity: Medium of instruction and examination shall be English alone. The minimum eligibility condition is 45% marks in 10+2, preference being given to those having higher marks. The marks scored in CLAT and L-SAT shall be given due weight in preparation of merit for admission.However it shall be open to the Director of MATS Law School to consider exceptional cases of less than 45% keeping in view that the University is situated in a tribal area. The maximum age for Honors degree courses shall be 20 years for General and OBC category and 22 years in case of candidates from SC/ST, as on 1st July of the year of admission. For LLB 3 years it shall be 30 years for general and OBC category and 32 for SC/ST as on 1st July of the year of admission. In case of marks being equal the weightage shall be given to girls in admission. However keeping the fact in mind that Chhattisgarh is tribal dominated area, it shall be open to the Director MATS Law School to relax the age requirement in appropriate cases.

(Hons.) 5-year Integrated Course Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree (2-Year Course) Examination of the Kurukshetra University or any Examination recognized as equivalent thereto, with English as one of the subjects in the qualifying examination and with at least 45% marks in the aggregate (40% for SC/ST candidates) in either of these Degree (One-Year Degree/Diploma Courses like, D.P.Ed., M.Ed., B.Ed., B.Lib. Sc., etc. shall not be considered as equivalent to Bachelor’s Degree).The minimum eligibility condition in the case of SC/ST/DAP Candidates shall be 42.75% marks in the qualifying Examination with English as one of the subjects. (There shall be no rounding of percentage of marks of the qualifying Examination i.e. 42.75% and 45% means exact percentage. Thus, 42.5% and above does not mean 43% or 44.5% and above does not mean 45%).

College: Indian Institute of Legal Studies, Darjeeling
Eligiblity: A student shall be eligible for admission into semester I of the B.A., LL.B. 5 year Integrated Course in Law if he / she has passed the Higher Secondary (10+2) examination held by the West Bengal Council of Higher Secondary Education or any other examination which is recognized by the University as equivalent thereto provided that :Such student must have obtained minimum 50% marks in the aggregate in the qualifying examination; person belonging to scheduled cast, scheduled tribes, other Backward classes (OBC) shall be eligible to apply if they secure at least 40 % marks in the qualifying examination.Such student has not passed any other examination higher than the 10+2 examination mentioned above prior to seeking admission into the course.The age of the applicant shall not be above 20 years in case of candidates belonging to the general category and shall not be above 22 years in case of applicants belonging to scheduled casts, scheduled tribes, other backward classes (OBC) category as on 1st July of the same academic year in which he or she may be seeking admission.
Course_Detail: The B.A., LL.B. [Gen.] integrated degree course in law is a five year course comprising of forty papers in ten semesters based on credit and grade system.The subjects and papers for the course shall be prescribed by the North Bengal University from time to time in accordance with the rules of the Bar Council of India.The duration of the cours...See More

Eligiblity: PUC or Senior Secondary School Courses (+2) or equivalent Such as (11+1’A’ Level in Senior School Leaving Certificate Course) from a recognized University of India or outside India or from Senior Secondary Board or equivalent, Constituted or recognized by the central or State Government or from any equivalent Institution from a foreign country recognized by the government of that country, for The purpose of issue of International qualifying certificate equivalent to (10+2) Apply for the Course. Provided those who have obtained +2 Higher Secondary Pass Certificate or First Degree Certificate or equivalent course through distance or correspondence method, only after Passing the basic qualification (1to10th Std) for prosecuting such Correspondence/Distance +2, Shall also be eligible for Admission to 5Year B.A LLB Course. Candidate who have scored 45% of marks in qualifying exam (PUC/10+2) and above in case of General Category (GM) shall be eligible for admission (44.5% and above shall be treated as 45% ) and 40% of marks in qualifying exam (PUC/10+2) in case of SC & ST Candidates (39.5%and above shall be treated as 40%)
